soot.jimple.infoflow

Class AbstractInfoflow

  • java.lang.Object
    • soot.jimple.infoflow.AbstractInfoflow
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IInfoflow
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BackwardInfoflow, Infoflow, PairingInfoflow

    public abstract class AbstractInfoflow
extends java.lang.Object
implements IInfoflow
    Abstract base class for all data/information flow analyses in FlowDroid
    Author:
    Steven Arzt

      Sets whether and how FlowDroid shall eliminate irrelevant code before running the taint propagation

      Sets whether the solver shall track taints of thrown exception objects

      Sets whether the solver shall consider implicit flows.

      Sets whether the solver shall consider assignments to static fields

      Sets whether type checking shall be done on casts and method calls
      void setFlowSensitiveAliasing(boolean flowSensitiveAliasing)
      Sets whether a flow sensitive aliasing algorithm shall be used
      void setIgnoreFlowsInSystemPackages(boolean ignoreFlowsInSystemPackages)
      Sets whether flows starting or ending in system packages such as Android's support library shall be ignored.
      void setInspectSinks(boolean inspect)
      default: inspectSinks is set to true, this means sinks are analyzed as well.

      default: inspectSources is set to true, this means sources are analyzed as well.
      void setMaxThreadNum(int threadNum)
      Sets the maximum number of threads to be used by the solver.

      Sets the handler class to be used for modeling the effects of native methods on the taint state

      List of preprocessors that need to be executed in order before the information flow.

      • computeInfoflow

        public void computeInfoflow(java.lang.String appPath,
                            java.lang.String libPath,
                            IEntryPointCreator entryPointCreator,
                            java.util.List<java.lang.String> sources,
                            java.util.List<java.lang.String> sinks)
        Description copied from interface: IInfoflow
        Computes the information flow on a list of entry point methods. This list is used to construct an artificial main method following the Android life cycle for all methods that are detected to be part of Android's application infrastructure (e.g. android.app.Activity.onCreate)
        Specified by:
        computeInfoflow in interface IInfoflow
        Parameters:
        appPath - The path containing the client program's files
        libPath - The path to the main folder of the (unpacked) library class files
        entryPointCreator - the entry point creator to use for generating the dummy main method
        sources - list of source class+method (as string conforms to SootMethod representation)
        sinks - list of sink class+method (as string conforms to SootMethod representation)

      • computeInfoflow

        public void computeInfoflow(java.lang.String appPath,
                            java.lang.String libPath,
                            java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> entryPoints,
                            java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> sources,
                            java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> sinks)
        Description copied from interface: IInfoflow
        Computes the information flow on a list of entry point methods. This list is used to construct an artificial main method following the Android life cycle for all methods that are detected to be part of Android's application infrastructure (e.g. android.app.Activity.onCreate)
        Specified by:
        computeInfoflow in interface IInfoflow
        Parameters:
        appPath - The path containing the client program's files
        libPath - the path to the main folder of the (unpacked) library class files
        entryPoints - the entryPoints (string conforms to SootMethod representation)
        sources - list of source class+method (as string conforms to SootMethod representation)
        sinks - list of sink class+method (as string conforms to SootMethod representation)

      • computeInfoflow

        public void computeInfoflow(java.lang.String libPath,
                            java.lang.String appPath,
                            java.lang.String entryPoint,
                            java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> sources,
                            java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> sinks)
        Description copied from interface: IInfoflow
        Computes the information flow on a single method. This method is directly taken as the entry point into the program, even if it is an instance method.
        Specified by:
        computeInfoflow in interface IInfoflow
        Parameters:
        libPath - The path containing the client program's files
        appPath - the path to the main folder of the (unpacked) library class files
        entryPoint - the main method to analyze
        sources - list of source class+method (as string conforms to SootMethod representation)
        sinks - list of sink class+method (as string conforms to SootMethod representation)

      • setInspectSources

        public void setInspectSources(boolean inspect)
        Description copied from interface: IInfoflow
        default: inspectSources is set to true, this means sources are analyzed as well. If inspectSources is set to false, then the analysis does not propagate values into the source method.
        Specified by:
        setInspectSources in interface IInfoflow
        Parameters:
        inspect - boolean that determines the inspectSource option

      • setInspectSinks

        public void setInspectSinks(boolean inspect)
        Description copied from interface: IInfoflow
        default: inspectSinks is set to true, this means sinks are analyzed as well. If inspectSinks is set to false, then the analysis does not propagate values into the sink method.
        Specified by:
        setInspectSinks in interface IInfoflow
        Parameters:
        inspect - boolean that determines the inspectSink option

      • setMaxThreadNum

        public void setMaxThreadNum(int threadNum)
        Description copied from interface: IInfoflow
        Sets the maximum number of threads to be used by the solver. A value of -1 indicates an unlimited number of threads, i.e., there will be as many threads as there are CPU cores on the machine.
        Specified by:
        setMaxThreadNum in interface IInfoflow
        Parameters:
        threadNum - The maximum number of threads to be used by the solver, or -1 for an unlimited number of threads.

      • setEnableTypeChecking

        Sets whether type checking shall be done on casts and method calls
        Specified by:
        setEnableTypeChecking in interface IInfoflow
        Parameters:
        enableTypeChecking - True if type checking shall be performed, otherwise false

        Description copied from interface: IInfoflow
        Sets whether flows starting or ending in system packages such as Android's support library shall be ignored.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
